newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai B index ends up slightly on rebound.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai B index ends up slightly on rebound.

text.p: Shanghai's B share index closed up slightly on Wednesday on a technical rebound following Tuesday's correction, with investors staying on the sidelines in a holiday mood, brokers said.
The B index inched up 0.037 points or 0.06 percent to 65.438 points, on volume of 16.5 million shares worth $7.2 million against $6.4 million on Tuesday.
Brokers said the index would continue to consolidate at current levels ahead of the two-week Chinese lunar new year holiday which begins on February 6.
"After the big gains of the past week, the market began to consolidate around the 65-point level, waiting for a further rise to the 68-point level," one broker said.
"With the lack of market-moving news, the holiday mood has dominated recent trading," a second broker said.
All 43 B shares traded, with 17 up, 10 flat and 16 down.
Food producer Shanghai Dajiang was the star on speculative buying, rising $0.036 or 6.64 percent to $0.578 on volume of 144,800 shares.
Shanghai Narcissus Electric Appliances followed on bargain-hunting. With 2.3 million shares traded it was heaviest trade of the session and rose $0.008 or 4.34 percent to $0.192.
Shanghai's A share market rose on cautious buying with some funds flowing in from the primary market after continous new issues in Shenzhen and Shanghai, brokers said.

The A index edged up 6.21 points or 0.62 percent to 1004.17 points with 382.1 million shares traded on turnover of 3.5 billion yuan. The SSE 30 blue-chip index rose 30.95 points or 1.2 percent to 2608.67 points.
Retailer Beijing Wangfujing was the star on institutional buying, surging 0.92 yuan or 10 percent to its limit-up of 10.12 yuan with 12.1 million shares traded.
